conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions team—I'm Student_B and I’m very excited about the chance to join School_B. It’s my first-choice school, and I would enthusiastically accept an offer if admitted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top true choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately rather than risk losing the only seat. Although School_B’s priority list ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A), applying now is still my best shot at securing my first choice and signals strong commitment.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your application and for sharing your strong interest in School_B. After reviewing current considerations, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your time and wish you the very best in the rest of the process.
conversation.thought: Student_B is 3rd on School_B’s true priority list (after Student_D and Student_A). With quota 1, accepting now would lock in a mid-priority match and forgo the chance to match with Student_D or Student_A, who both rank School_B reasonably high (both list School_B as 3rd choice) and may apply later depending on their outcomes at higher-ranked schools. Since we can reject and keep the seat open, it is strategically better to wait for higher-priority candidates rather than commit immediately to Student_B.

conversation.message: Hello School_C Admissions, I’m Student_D. School_C is my first choice because I’m strongly interested in your academic environment and school culture, and I would be excited to commit and contribute if admitted. I’d like to formally apply for your available seat. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd after Student_C and Student_B). If I apply immediately, I may secure the seat unless higher-priority students also apply and are accepted. It’s best to go for my #1 first rather than settling early, and I can emphasize fit and commitment to encourage acceptance if they have discretion among applicants.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for placing School_C as your first choice. We appreciate your interest in our academic environment and community.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_C. Congratulations—we look forward to having you join us.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list is Student_C > Student_B > Student_D > Student_E > Student_A. Student_D is my 3rd choice and is applying now with School_C as their 1st choice, so accepting would secure a solid match immediately. However, Student_C and Student_B are ranked above Student_D; if I accept now, I lose the chance to match with either if they later apply. Looking at student preferences: Student_C ranks School_C 4th (likely to apply elsewhere first), and Student_B ranks School_C 5th (very unlikely to apply). Student_E ranks School_C 1st and is ranked 4th on my list; Student_E may apply soon and would be a worse match than Student_D. Given the low probability that Student_C or Student_B will come to me, and the risk of ending up with Student_E or no one later, it is optimal to accept Student_D now to fill my single quota with a relatively high-priority candidate.

conversation.message: Hello School_D—I'm Student_C. School_D is my first-choice school, and I’m applying because I strongly want to join your community and commit fully if accepted. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. I’m mid-ranked there (behind Student_D and Student_E), so I should apply immediately before they potentially fill the single seat. Even if rejected, I can move quickly to my next choices in later rounds; delaying only increases the risk that School_D is taken.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for sharing that School_D is your first choice. After reviewing applications this round and considering our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We truly appreciate your interest in School_D and wish you the very best in your placement process. [REJECT]
conversation.thought: As School_D, my true priority ranking is D > E > C > B > A. In this round I received applications from Student_C and Student_E. Student_E is ranked higher than Student_C on my list, and I have only 1 seat. If I accept Student_C now, I foreclose the chance to match with Student_E (or Student_D if they later apply). Given full information, Student_D’s top choice is School_C, so they are unlikely to apply to me first; however Student_E has already applied, and I prefer E over C. Therefore I should reject Student_C to preserve capacity for Student_E (and potentially Student_D).

conversation.message: Dear School_D Admissions, I’m Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_D and I’m applying formally. I believe I would be a strong fit for your program and community, and I’m ready to commit if accepted. Thank you for your consideration.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but I have relatively low priority there (4th), while Student_C and Student_B are likely to apply and outrank me. Since matches lock in immediately upon acceptance, applying to School_C now is likely to be rejected and wastes the round. My best strategic move is to apply to School_D: it is 4th on my list but School_D ranks me 2nd overall, so I have a strong chance to be accepted even if others apply. Securing School_D early avoids the risk of ending up with my bottom choice later.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and for your strong interest in School_D. We are pleased to offer you admission and would be excited to welcome you to our community. Congratulations, and we look forward to having you join School_D. [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_D’s true priority is D > E > C > B > A. In this round, applicants are Student_C and Student_E. Student_E is ranked higher than Student_C, and we already rejected Student_C earlier. Our quota is 1, and accepting Student_E secures our second-highest priority candidate. Waiting for Student_D is risky because Student_D’s preferences place School_D last, so they are unlikely to apply. Therefore, accept Student_E now to maximize outcome given market dynamics.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions, I’m Student_A and I’m formally applying because School_A is my first-choice school. I’m highly motivated to join your community and would immediately accept an offer. If admitted, I’m ready to contribute strongly in academics and school activities and I’m committed to making School_A my top priority this cycle.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Although School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), there is still a chance they do not apply there first (their top choices are School_B and School_C respectively). Applying now maximizes my chance to secure my #1 before the seat is taken, and I will emphasize strong fit and commitment to increase the likelihood of acceptance if they have discretion.

conversation.message: Dear Student_A, thank you for your sincere application and for placing School_A as your first choice. After reviewing our current priorities and limited capacity, we’re not able to extend an offer to you at this time. We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best in the remainder of the process.
conversation.thought: Student_A is applying now and ranks 3rd on School_A's true priority list (behind Student_B and Student_D). With quota 1, accepting Student_A in round 1 would lock in a suboptimal match and prevent taking Student_B or Student_D if they apply later. Given full information: Student_B's top choice is School_B (but School_B ranks Student_D then Student_A above Student_B, so Student_B may be rejected there and could later apply to School_A as their 3rd choice). Student_D's top choice is School_C (which ranks Student_C then Student_B then Student_D, so Student_D might be rejected and could apply to School_A as their 2nd choice). Therefore, there is a reasonable chance a higher-priority student (B or D) will approach School_A in subsequent rounds. Best strategy is to reject Student_A now to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates.

conversation.message: Dear School_A Admissions Team, I’m Student_B. School_A is one of my top choices, and I would be excited to join your community. I’m especially drawn to the academic environment and the chance to contribute actively to school life. If offered admission, I would accept promptly. Thank you very much for your consideration.
conversation.thought: School_B (my top choice) already rejected me. Among remaining unmatched schools, School_A is my 3rd choice and, importantly, School_A ranks me #1 in its priority list, giving me the best chance to secure a high-ranked match immediately. I will apply with a clear commitment and highlight fit and readiness to enroll.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and thoughtful interest in School_A. We are pleased to offer you admission. If you remain ready to commit, we look forward to welcoming you to our community.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B is #1 on School_A’s true priority list. We have quota 1 and currently no matches. In this round we also received an application from Student_C, who is last (#5) on our priority list. Given Student_B’s top rank and stated willingness to accept promptly, accepting now secures our best possible outcome; there is no higher-priority candidate to wait for (Student_D is #2 but has School_C as first choice and may not apply). Therefore, accept Student_B immediately.

conversation.message: Hello School_A—I'm Student_C. I’m applying because School_A is one of my top choices, and I would be excited to commit if admitted. I value your academic environment and the chance to contribute positively to the school community through consistent effort and respectful collaboration. conversation.thought: School_D (my 1st choice) already rejected me. Among remaining unmatched schools, School_A is my 2nd choice, so I should apply there now. Although School_A ranks me last in its priority list, it may still be attainable if higher-priority students choose other schools. A clear, committed application emphasizing fit and readiness to enroll can help if School_A is deciding among lower-priority applicants.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for your interest in School_A. At this time, our incoming class is at capacity and we’re unable to extend an offer. We appreciate the care you put into your message and wish you the very best in the remainder of the admissions process.

Sincerely,
School_A Admissions
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled with Student_B, who is also our top-ranked student on our true priority list. Per rules, with remaining quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY] messages. Student_C is lowest on our priority list anyway, so even with capacity we would not displace Student_B.

conversation.message:
Dear School_B Admissions,

I’m Student_A and I’m submitting a formal application to School_B. While it isn’t my first choice, School_B is a strong fit for me and I would be excited to enroll if offered a place. I’m ready to commit promptly and would contribute positively to the school community through consistent academic effort and participation in activities.

Thank you for considering my application.

Sincerely,
Student_A
conversation.thought: School_A (my 1st choice) already rejected me and has capacity 1, so re-applying is unlikely to succeed. School_C and School_D are already matched, so they’re unavailable. Among remaining options, School_B is my 4th choice but I have relatively strong priority there (2nd after Student_D). If Student_D is accepted elsewhere, School_B becomes a realistic path to a decent match, so I should apply now rather than wait and risk losing the seat.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your application and for your thoughtful note about how you would contribute to our community. We are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. Please confirm your intention to enroll according to the process timeline.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions
conversation.thought: School_B has quota 1 and true priority ranks Student_D highest, then Student_A. Student_B already applied and was rejected to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates. In round 2, only Student_A has applied to School_B. Student_A ranks School_B 4th, so they may leave if accepted elsewhere, but acceptance here finalizes the match and secures our second-highest priority student. Waiting for Student_D is risky: Student_D’s top choices are School_C then School_A then School_B, and School_C prioritizes Student_D highly (3rd) while School_A prioritizes Student_D 2nd, so Student_D is likely to match before reaching us. Therefore, accept Student_A now to ensure a high-priority match rather than risk ending unmatched or with a lower-priority student later.

conversation.message: Hello School_E—I'm Student_C. I’m applying for admission and would be ready to commit if accepted. While my earlier applications did not work out, I genuinely respect School_E’s community and would be grateful for the opportunity to join, contribute consistently in class, and support school activities with a positive attitude. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: Only School_E remains unmatched, and it is on my true preference list (though last). Since I’ve already been rejected by my higher-ranked choices and this may be my final opportunity to secure a match, I should apply directly and clearly signal commitment to increase my chances of acceptance.

conversation.message: Student_C, thank you for your thoughtful application. We appreciate your interest in School_E and your commitment to contributing to our community. We are happy to offer you admission—welcome to School_E.
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and are currently unmatched. Student_C is 2nd on School_E’s true priority list (only behind Student_A). In this round, only Student_C applied to us, and there is no indication Student_A is approaching School_E (Student_A ranks School_E last). Holding out risks ending unmatched or accepting a lower-priority student later. Accepting Student_C now secures a very high-priority match and is consistent with our objective.
